meanings.definition: A person who performs magic tricks or illusions for entertainment.
meanings.sent1: The conjuror amazed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: The children were thrilled to watch the conjuror pull a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent3: The conjuror's tricks were so convincing that even the adults were left in awe.
meanings.sent4: Watching the conjuror in action was like witnessing real-life magic.
meanings.sent5: The conjuror's performance was so captivating that it felt like stepping into a fantasy world.

meanings.definition: One who calls upon spirits or supernatural forces.
meanings.sent1: The old conjuror was said to have the power to communicate with spirits.
meanings.sent2: In folklore, the conjuror was believed to have the ability to summon ghosts.
meanings.sent3: The conjuror's spooky incantations made everyone shiver with fear.
meanings.sent4: The conjuror's connection to the supernatural world was both eerie and fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The conjuror's mysterious rituals seemed to bridge the gap between the living and the dead.
